Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of RPD's rejection of testimony
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: RPD rejected testimony due to lack of documentation and inability to name medication
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to forced abortion under one-child policy
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Plausible reasons required for rejecting testimony
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Requirement of corroborative evidence without contradiction deemed unreasonable
Crimes.Application_Error: Requiring documentation and specific medical knowledge as basis for disbelief
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, remitted for redetermination
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Evidence of advanced pregnancy and parental support not negating coercion
Crimes.Application_Factor: Inability to provide corroborative evidence due to circumstances
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether RPD provided adequate reasons to reject testimony
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule requiring plausible justification for credibility findings
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived implausibility and lack of corroboration
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentary proof and specificity in testimony
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to fairly assess testimony without contradictory evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Testimony dismissed on grounds of implausibility without sufficient rationale
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged unreasonableness of RPD’s adverse credibility finding
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Canadian refugee law and international protection principles
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper burden placed on applicant for corroboration
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to consider contextual evidence supporting claim

Crimes.Crime_Name: Violation of reproductive rights under Chinese law
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee protection claim based on reproductive coercion
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Validity of RPD's implausibility finding regarding forced abortion
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Testimony weighed against country conditions and medical plausibility
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish subjective fear and objective basis
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies in testimony used to reject claim
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Implausibility must be supported by evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Requirement of corroboration without contradictory evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Forced abortion and IUD insertion under one-child policy
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed initially, later found flawed
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unfair to expect detailed medical knowledge from applicant
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: RPD failed to justify rejection of credible testimony
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court case law on credibility assessment
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Minister conceded errors but defended overall validity
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Requirement for rational justification in credibility determinations

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim based on gender-based persecution

Crimes.Outcome: RPD decision overturned on judicial review

Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Refugee protection and safe haven in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International refugee law and human rights law
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Credible testimony supported by context; no undue demand for corroboration
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Refugee Protection Division hearing and decision
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada (refugee determination), conduct occurred in China

Crimes.Temporal_Context: During enforcement period of China's one-child policy

Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Lack of effective state protection in home country
Crimes.Risk_Factor: History of forced abortion increases risk of recurrence

Crimes.State_Protection_Adequacy: Inadequate protection against forced abortion in China
